description.narrative: The purpose of this consultancy is doing a fresh assessment of the existing Humanitarian capacities of Pakistan#s government structures, and local civil society organizations; and presenting proposals to move forward the development of Humanitarian capacities in Pakistan. The guiding methodology has been the so called HUCOCA (Humanitarian Country Capacities Analysis), specifically developed for this Fresh Analysis exercises. This analysis has been done using a #Critical building up approach#, meaning that it has taken into account some of the works already done by Oxfam in Pakistan, as well as other humanitarian documents of reference for Pakistan. The Pakistan Humanitarian Profile: Pakistan is a disaster prone country. Floods causes millions of people affected and losses of billons of dollar per year, earthquakes, droughts, cyclones and ongoing operations against militancy provoke humanitarian crises. During consultation with humanitarian actors, it was noticed that humanitarianism in Pakistan is mainly focused on Emergency activities related to natural Disasters. Rescue and Relief occupy most of the action and concerns of humanitarian actors. Disaster Risk Reduction and Resilience building is not yet a central axis of humanitarian practice. Rights of people affected by Disasters, Governance and Responsibility issues, root causes of disasters, analysis of vulnerabilities and in summary a more comprehensive understanding of what Humanitarianism is about is weak as a matter of practice.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
